summary: Completely renews the interior of Breezehome. Adding a whole heap of visual goodness and also has all the tools the Thane needs which can all be found in their own respectable areas.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i244.photobucket.com/albums/gg6/oooStormCrowooo/H1_zps4f5cb101.png[/img]
[size=9][b][color=#EAAE32]─[/color][color=#E9AF38]─[/color][color=#E9B13E]─[/color][color=#E9B344]─[/color][color=#E9B54A]─[/color][color=#E9B751]─[/color][color=#E9B957]─[/color][color=#E9BB5D]─[/color][font=Palatino Linotype][color=#E9BD63]D[/color][color=#E9BF6A]E[/color][color=#E9C170]S[/color][color=#E9C376]C[/color][color=#E9C57C]R[/color][color=#E9C782]I[/color][color=#E9C782]P[/color][color=#E9C57C]T[/color][color=#E9C376]I[/color][color=#E9C170]O[/color][color=#E9BF6A]N[/color][/font][color=#E9BD63]─[/color][color=#E9BB5D]─[/color][color=#E9B957]─[/color][color=#E9B751]─[/color][color=#E9B54A]─[/color][color=#E9B344]─[/color][color=#E9B13E]─[/color][color=#E9AF38]─[/color][/size][/b]

[size=5][color=orange]Prepare to renew Breezehome in a way that better befits the Thane
of Whiterun. This design aims to provide the player with all the tools
that he/she needs, while still maintaining the looks and feel of
a "proper home".  The renovation takes advantage of the limited
space of Breezehome giving it a very detailed look and includes a neatly
placed basement that follows the same principal of limited space. All the
crafting tables are located in the basement and has their own special area.
The author of this mod has extremely high experience and a long history
with playing The Sims, all the way back to the first Sims game. Also, for
balance the value of Breezehome has been raised from 5000 to 12 000 gold,
but if you've already purchased Breezehome then count yourself lucky.[/color][/size]

      ♦ Ignitable fireplace [/size][i][color=grey]- which can be activated via a switch on the fireplace in the basement[/color][/i][size=3]
      ♦ High quality lighting [/size][i][color=grey]- thanks to the "just in time" script by Daemonjax[/color][/i][size=3]
      ♦ Lots of Bookcases, weapon mounts, display cases, storage
      ♦ 6 Mannequins [/size][i][color=grey]- (optional)[/color][/i][size=3]
      ♦ Alchemy, enchanting, smithing, cooking areas
      ♦ Two-tier basement
      ♦ Unique furniture such as "realistic" cabinets and bookcases
      ♦ Hearthfires DLC support[/size]

[/size]Normal installation:
[list=1][*]Extract files to [i]'.../Skyrim/Data'[/i] folder[/*]
[*]Enable mod in Skyrim Launcher or Nexus Mod Manager[/*]
[/list]

[size=2][color=#FFFF30][b]Q:[/b][/color][/size] Is this mod compatible with Hearthfire?
[size=2][color=#3FED0C][b]A:[/b][/color][/size] Yes.

[size=2][color=#FFFF30][b]Q:[/b][/color][/size] Why are some lights flashing when I move the camera?
[size=2][color=#3FED0C][b]A:[/b][/color][/size] If the flashing light is of the type that casts a shadow you've likely managed to bypass one of the "invisible" activators that determines which lights should be on/off and as a result there are more than 4 shadow casting lights at once. To fix this problem, take a walk around all the areas in the house so that the light script knows where you are.

[size=2][color=#FFFF30][b]Q:[/b][/color][/size] I aldready own Breezehome, can I still use this mod?
[size=2][color=#3FED0C][b]A:[/b][/color][/size] Yes, all you need is the key to Breezehome which you have already purchased. Also make sure to grab all your gear from vanilla Breezehome before using the mod permanently. If you wish to test the mod before using it, simply try the mod without overwriting any important save data (beware of autosave).

[size=2][color=#FFFF30][b]Q:[/b][/color][/size] The house will not load and the game crashes, what is the problem?
[size=2][color=#3FED0C][b]A:[/b][/color][/size] You either have Hearthfire and did not download the "Hearthfire Edition" of this mod. Or it is caused by a conflict between [i]Thane's Breezehome[/i] and another mod in your load order. Go to "Data Files" in the Skyrim Launcher and try disabling any other mod that makes changes to Whiterun city or Breezehome and set [i]Thane's Breezehome.esp[/i] to load last in your load order, then try again.

[size=2][color=#FFFF30][b]Q:[/b][/color][/size] Some of the weapon mounts are not working.
[size=2][color=#3FED0C][b]A:[/b][/color][/size] If your game is heavy modded and has a lot of scripts running in the background, this may be the cause. As it might take some time for it to go into effect you can either try to wait and see if the problem solves itself or disable a heavy scripted mod and see if it helps.

author: StormCrow06

files.name: High-end Version
files.changelogHtml:
Solved problem with Lydia not going home
Improved and fully tested navmesh
Made changes to lighting and minor adjustments to objects
Added ignitable fireplace via a switch in the basement
Less buggy mannequins thanks to a tip from KnightRangersGuild

files.name: Breezehome 4_1
files.changelogHtml:
Restored some of vanilla Breezehome for better compatibility.
20% less clutter.
Removed annoying wind sound in the basement.
Significantly better lighting with the use of Just In Time script by Daemonjax
Restored Lydia to vanilla, making problems much less likely to occur.
Changed Breezehome cost from 5000 gold to 12 000.
Revised navmesh
Fixed problem with containers not being unique.
Made requested changes like two activators for the player bed and straighten the safe in players bedroom.
Removed some furniture, display cases and bookshelves
Added new display cases and bookshelves
